title: Stasi: Parents of gun-toting kids should be held responsible
text:
HANDOUT/Reuters Nancy Lanza, pictured in 2008, kept guns in her home regularly and encouraged her son Adam to learn how to use them, despite knowing he was mentally disturbed. In nearly every state, it’s illegal for bartenders to serve booze to drunken patrons.
If they do and that drunk then gets behind the wheel and ends up killing or injuring someone, the server and/or the bar owner can be charged criminally and held responsible for damages civily.
That is, of course, the civil thing to do. After all, one third of all traffic fatalities in the United States (12,000 a year) are caused by impaired drivers.
But parents who give their kids “long guns” — rifles or shotguns? They’re good to go.
And if those kids are deranged sociopaths or on psychiatric drugs — which can lead to homicidal tendencies — but have never been involuntarily committed or been formally determined by a court to be mentally ill? Still good to go.
Kids can even possess “handguns if a parent has provided consent and the state law allows it,” according to Lindsay Nichols at Smartgunlaws.org.
FIND OUT HOW MUCH MONEY THE GUN LOBBY GIVES TO YOUR LOCAL OFFICIAL
Plenty of harm, no federal foul.
handout A photo of Adam Lanza as a young boy. He had been around guns all his life, even though his parents knew he was mentally disturbed. On Friday, yet another killer who doesn’t deserve to have his name in print, shot and killed a fellow student, Colin Brough at Northern Arizona University, and injured several others. Another weekend, another school shooting.
When does it end? When do we get the guns out of the hands of mentally unhinged youth? Maybe when their parents step up and take responsibility.
Myspace Christopher Harper-Mercer's mother had the family move to Oregon in order "to open carry." For example, both mentally disturbed Adam Lanza (the Sandy Hook deranged mass murderer), and Christopher Harper-Mercer, Oregon’s cowardly psychopathic school shooter, were disturbed loners living with gun-loving mothers; mothers who kept arsenals at home while their sons were growing up, encouraged gun use by those sons even knowing they were mentally disturbed and obsessed with guns and violence.
New York Daily News/New York Daily News Parents like Laurel Harper, who allowed her son to be around guns despite being mentally unstable, should be charged with crimes as well, Linda Stasi says. The medicated Lanza was so deranged that he communicated only with his mother who lived in the same house via email and stayed inside playing violent video games like “School Shooter.” The Oregonian reported “There are a number of indications that Harper-Mercer had mental health or behavioral issues. His screen name on some social media sites was ‘lithium love.’ Lithium is used as a psychiatric medication,” and has been linked to risks for violent and homicidal behavior.
Still Harper-Mercer’s mother, Laurel Harper, a practical nurse yet, had posted that she moved them from California to Oregon “to open carry.”
CCHR International recently reported that “35 school shootings and/or school associated acts of violence (which includes guns, knives, and swords) with 169 wounded and 79 killed have been committed by students and others taking or withdrawing from psychiatric drugs.”
Lanza, who had been on such meds, was so deranged that he dwelt in the basement, communicated only with his mother who lived in the same house via email, kept black plastic garbage bags over his windows, and stayed inside playing violent video games like “School Shooter.”
Bottom line: Parents who buy guns and encourage gun use by their mentally ill kids, especially those who are on psychiatric drugs, should be charged as accessories to murder.
Of course, Nancy Lanza can’t be charged with anything. Her deranged son shot her to death, and then went out to kill little children.
D.C. IS SO FULL OF ‘HACKS
Talk about a glass House!
Sen. Ron Johnson (R., Wis.), chairman of the Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs Committee, is going bonkers because hackers in China, South Korea and Germany may have attempted to penetrate Hillary Clinton’s personal email server for three months — after she left office.
Meantime, during that same time, Chinese cyberattackers were reading U.S. government emails and last December stole the personal information and security-clearance files of 22 million federal employees, contractors, their family and friends.
HANDOUT/MCT Kevin McCarthy was a t one time favored to be named the new Speaker of the House, but recently withdrew. Enlarge J. Meric/Getty Images Rep. Renee Ellmers (R-NC) was named in a Wikipedia article, which was posted by a someone using an email address from Homeland Security, as having had an affair with McCarthy. Enlarge Married House Majority Leader Kevin McCarthy dropped out of the race for House Speaker after there were
It gets worse. On Thursday, married House Majority Leader Kevin McCarthy (R-Calif.) dropped out of the speaker’s race after Wikipedia entries for both McCarthy and married Rep. Renee Ellmers (R-N.C.) alleged an affair between them. And the person who added it? The poster used an email address from Johnson’s own beloved Homeland Security!
Maybe Hillary had the only secure server after all — well, until the FBI got involved, at any rate.
ISIS TOO EVIL EVEN FOR VLAD
Making the world safe for dictators everywhere!
Vlad (the Impaler) Putin first managed to give refuge to and “save the life” of Ukrainian’s ousted dictator Viktor Yanukovych (before taking over the brute’s country). Then he claimed that the well-equipped, unidentified invading troops with tanks and billions in equipment weren’t Russian.
Now Putin is bombing the hell out of U.S.-supported Syrian rebels against brutal President Bashar al-Assad, claiming this time that Russians are only bombing ISIS.
Alexei Druzhinin/ASSOCIATED PRESS Vladimir Putin is trying to claim that his country is only bombing ISIS, but a report shows that the terrorist group is making very large strides in northwestern Syria — right where Russia has been bombing. HO/AFP/Getty Images Bashar al-Assad is being supported by Putin, while the U.S. has backed the rebels trying oust the Syrian leader. Previous Next Enlarge It ain’t working — neither the lies nor the bombs. The New York Times reports that ISIS is making big strides in northwestern Syria — in the very areas the Russians have been bombing.
Even The Impaler doesn’t understand the savagery of ISIS. And you always thought it took one to know one.
BIEBS OFF OLD BLOCK
That’s some big vacation you got there, son! Justin Bieber’s balcony-dog-tossing/apartment-trashing father took to Twitter to praise his son on Friday.
No, not for Bieber’s huge following, but because of what he’s got in front.

What can you expect from a guy who, in a rage, allegedly hurled the family dog off a second story balcony, or so his dog trainer told to TMZ.
THE JENNERS FLEW VERY-FRIENDLY SKIES
Some women just can’t accept it when a husband leaves them for another woman — even if the other woman is the husband.
Kris Jenner told Cosmo that after she and then-Bruce had sex in the first-class bathroom of a commercial airliner,the flight attendant took to the mike to announce, “Congratulations, Mr. and Mrs. Jenner! You’ve just joined the mile-high club. We’re so proud of you, and we decided to give you a bottle of champagne!”
Just more inane Kardashian lie-and-pie-in-the-sky?
A BIG MISS-TAKE
It sounds like one of those TV disclaimers at the end of an erectile dysfunction ad. Warning: Phubbing and FOMO can lead to depression, sexual disinterest and relationship woes.
A survey by Baylor University of 450 adults shows that phubbing — “being snubbed by a partner constantly checking a smartphone” — can lead to all of the above. And when combined with FOMO (fear of missing out), the result is positively prehistoric.
One shrink, Anita Sanz, told Quora.com that it harkens back to the time when a caveman “missing out on something could mean the difference between life and death.”
Conclusion? Obsesively checking FB can lead to LAWC — living alone with cats.
